verses.text: One Sabbath, as Jesus went to eat at the house of a leader among the Pharisees, they were watching Him closely.
verses.comment: In this scene, Jesus attends a meal at a Pharisee's house on the Sabbath, setting up a context for revealing His authority over the Law. Note the tension with the religious leaders (see Matt. 12:10), and the reverence for Sabbath traditions.

verses.text: Right in front of Him was a man suffering from dropsy.
verses.comment: Luke notes the presence of someone sick, inviting Jesus' compassion and demonstrating His divine power to heal, even when under scrutiny.

verses.text: Jesus responded to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, 'Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath, or not?'
verses.comment: Jesus invokes the Law by directly questioning the religious leaders about the Sabbath, highlighting the deeper meaning of mercy over mere ritual (see Hosea 6:6, Matt. 12:7).

verses.text: But they remained silent. Then He took hold of the man, healed him, and sent him away.
verses.comment: Their silence echoes their inability to answer divine wisdom. Jesus openly heals, revealing His authority to act on the Sabbath and foreshadowing His power to forgive and bring restoration (see Mark 3:4).

verses.text: He asked them, 'Which of you, if his son or ox falls into a well on the Sabbath day, would not immediately pull him out?'
verses.comment: Here, Jesus compares the necessity of mercy (rescuing those in need) with keeping ritual law. This teaches that the law is fulfilled by love, a principle that underpins deeper Christian living.

verses.text: And they could not reply to these things.
verses.comment: The leaders are unable to refute Jesus, revealing His divine wisdom and the limitations of their legalistic perspective.

verses.text: When He noticed how the guests chose the places of honor, He told them a parable.
verses.comment: Jesus uses the occasion to teach humility, reflecting Old Testament wisdom (Prov. 25:6â€“7) and preparing the way for spiritual elevation through humility.

verses.text: 'When you are invited by someone to a wedding banquet, do not sit in the place of honor, lest someone more distinguished than you be invited by him,'
verses.comment: His teaching uses everyday life to convey spiritual truths: humility brings true honor, a principle foundational throughout Scripture.
